scopecontent.p: Maps and information pertaining to the original ownership of lots of land in the city of Philadelphia. Done by the surveyor, John H. Dye. The survey is based on two acts, one of 1781 that allowed the Supreme Executive Council to sell lots, and the other of Assembly in 1803 which allowed the inspectors of the prison to sell vacant lots and use the proceeds to build a new facility. The volume is indexed by owner of property.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
